title: Toxic players, nothing being done about reports against them
body: Hey guys, gunna get straight to the point, whenever I report a player, for whatever reason, nothing gets done about it, ever, just the other day, I had a team mate threaten to kill one of our other team members and then rape his mother, I highly doubt this would ever come to fruition but that's not the point, I have team members, and opponents telling me, and other team members to kill themselves on countless occasions, all because they made a mistake or two, it's as if all these people have never made a mistake themselves and expect us all to be fucking LCS level players, all you toxic players out there seriously need to grow the fuck up and stop being so fucking pathetic all the time, and Riot, yall need to actually fucking do something about these players, League of Legends is  great game, but has by far the most pathetic and toxic community I've ever come across, just grow up guys, seriously, rant over.

replies.body: I don't know if Riot actually ever does anything about things like toxic players lol

oh they do, the other day me and my friends all reported this guys for being a real toxic fella, saying dodgey as hell stuff in chat and feeding etc. after the game 5 mins later we all got a popup saying "a player you recently reported has received penalties blah blah". there was no better feeling than seeing that!

i think its just theyve gotta get enough bans. your report might not necessarily directly get them banned but it contributes.

kinda like saying "everytime i vote at an election they never answer my vote"

Yeah, I've gotten that a few times.

Once was for this guy running down mid on my team, cause he got tilted
Another was just this guy being really toxic, etc

Love the feeling
I reported many for being toxic like saying "Kys and ur family" etc and I don't get this feedback from riot?

Well I've been told that if someone is actually being toxic, take screenshots and report them to Riot Support.

The best advice ever given to me is to /mute all, or if you don't mind your teammates, then just turn off the /all chat.

Muting them won't fix *their* behaviour. It's a bandaid for the victim, not a deterrent for the aggressor. And, unfortunately, I have little faith in the Riot Support Staff when it comes to doing what they say/said they would do with players who break the Summoner Code and that you report via tickets (my own experience there, off topic and too long to go into here). 

This game has gotten huge since I first started playing in S2 and, even though Riot have done amazing research and work in the area of Player Behaviour, I think this is the #1 area in which Riot are faltering when it comes to honouring their promises and meeting the needs of their wider community. 

The only solution I can see is Riot putting more in-house resources into the judiciary side of Player Behaviour, even if it costs them funds to do so. League of Legends may be one of the most popular games played with an enormous playerbase, but Riot are losing a steady amount of disgruntled customers because of the rampant negativity of a growing number of players lacking in basic self-control and who, without care or second thought, act out in ways that would not be tolerated if not for the fact they are safe behind their keyboards. These players simply need a transparent and immediate reason not to. And it would be beneficial to all if Riot could come up with a workable solution sooner rather than later.

Riot gives 0 sh its! 

Yes they have a shi tty automated ban system 

BUT GUESS WHAT!

TAKES 10 SEC TO CREATE ANOTHER ACCOUNT AND THEY CAN CONTINUE TO BE TOXIC AGAIN!

BAN DOES NOTHING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I do wonder about this every time i see players with thousands of wins that are still toxic.

Yeah, probably that's why my account on EUNE is permabanned, because riot does nothing about toxicity to protect kids from me, who are at least 10 times more toxic than I am.

Right? Stop crying.

But they only care about ranked.
You can be as toxic as you like in alternate formats and nothing is done about it.

A few things I'd like to clarify here:

_I think you're making the mistake of assuming that these people are toxic all the time._


  + Most people believe that all the toxic players, will always be toxic in all their games no matter what. That is definitely true in some cases, but in **most** cases people are just having a very rare "bad day" and they flip-out in chat.

               That doesn't make their actions excusable of course, but it's important to remember that people you meet in League have real lives with real issues. _**Not everyone who seems at first toxic is always like that.**_


_Just because you didn't receive [this](https://i.gyazo.com/e44989b804b8e645eb113ba47155ec45.png) notification, doesn't mean your report did nothing._

 + You only get that notification if the person you reported gets punished within a few days of you reporting them. 

 Sometimes you'll report someone but their behaviour wasn't severe or frequent enough to warrant punishment. But now thanks to your report, it will be easier for that person to be punished at a later date.

Most of the other points you made were really good though. Toxicity **definitely** still a looming issue that needs to be fixed. **Riot**'s got the new tribunal still in the works which should help, and there's now also talks of a honour rework later on, which might encourage more positive behaviour.

Thanks for bringing this up :)

Words wont hurt you sweetheart
Toxic players are ones who troll pick, feed, etc.
Become an adult, it lies within you.
